com.williballenthin.rejistry

Class HBIN

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.williballenthin.rejistry.BinaryBlock
      • com.williballenthin.rejistry.HBIN

  • public class HBIN
extends BinaryBlock
    HBIN is an allocation unit of a Registry hive that is usually 0x1000 bytes long.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HBIN(REGFHeader header, java.nio.ByteBuffer buf, int offset) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Iterator<Cell> getCells()
      getCellss creates an iterator over the Cells that make up this HBIN The iterator does not support the `remove` operation.
      int getRelativeOffsetFirstHBIN()
      getRelativeOffsetFirstHBIN fetches the relative offset from the start of this HBIN to the first HBIN in the hive.
      int getRelativeOffsetNextHBIN()
      getRelativeOffsetNextHBIN fetches the relative offset from the start of this HBIN to the next HBIN structure.

     throws RegistryParseException
        Parameters:
        header -

        Throws:
        RegistryParseException - if the magic header is not the ASCII string "HBIN".

    • Method Detail

      • getRelativeOffsetNextHBIN

        public int getRelativeOffsetNextHBIN()
        getRelativeOffsetNextHBIN fetches the relative offset from the start of this HBIN to the next HBIN structure. I suppose it is probably be positive, but would be pretty cool if it were negative. This also probably describes the length of this HBIN. Note, if this is not a positive number, then other parsing code in this library will be broken (see `getCells`).
        Returns:
        The relative offset to the next HBIN.

      • getRelativeOffsetFirstHBIN

        public int getRelativeOffsetFirstHBIN()
        getRelativeOffsetFirstHBIN fetches the relative offset from the start of this HBIN to the first HBIN in the hive. This will be a positive number, which is the number of bytes you need to go backwards to get the first HBIN.
        Returns:
        The relative offset to the first HBIN in the hive.

      • getCells

        @Nullable
public java.util.Iterator<Cell> getCells()
        getCellss creates an iterator over the Cells that make up this HBIN The iterator does not support the `remove` operation.
        Returns:
        An iterator over the Cells in this HBIN.
